author: 8by2
title: Cute caricature version of the classic Millenium Falcon
review:
A great little giveaway build at UK TRU stores the weekend of 7th/8th May 2016.  

Instructions

Folded A4, which has a very nice picture of the large scale 75105 Millenium Falcon being constructed on the front.

[img]https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7171/26783127112_a3f817a331_b.jpg[/img]

 

Parts

44 pieces

The build

My kids enjoyed making this, even when it was late in the day when the pieces were scarce. There were a few fiddly bits including the final gun turret and radar dish.

The completed model

A diminutive 8 studs long by 8.5 studs wide.  The ship is unmistakable, even with transparent rear thrusters and side mounted cockpit.  

[img]https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7626/26808875631_54ca72704e_b.jpg[/img]

[img]https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7326/26603460860_3ca7fde06b_b.jpg[/img]

Fairly playable except for the gun turret which is liable to fall off easily.  Otherwise the rest of the model is pretty solid.

Overall opinion

This is a chunky version of the Falcon, which is akin to the micro-fighters styled version.  A nice addition to the previous Star Wars models TRU have given us, including the Poe's X-Wing and Wookie's Gunship.
